utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God. Oh my God, you’re proposing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, you’re surprised.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course I’m surprised! I thought you were breaking up with me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By offering you a ring?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you just – you seemed so serious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, of course I’m serious. This is the most serious thing I’ve ever done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh! God!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So that’s a yes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, wait.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no. Not no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So yes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not yes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Not not yes. I – I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You do know how this works, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s something I have to tell you. I got the job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In DC?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I love you. But this is my shot. And if I don’t do this, I’ll always regret it. Look, if this changes anything for you, if this changes the way that you feel –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate, I’m not proposing to you to keep you here, or because I’m afraid I’m going to lose you. I’m proposing because I can’t imagine my life without you. If that means when things get difficult we have to figure them out then I’m willing to figure them out. Assuming you’re willing to figure them out with me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well in that case, Richard Edgar Alexander Rodgers Castle, yes. Yes. I will marry you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s … big.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you just have remarkably tiny fingers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re going to be able to make this work, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re going to be great. DC is going to be great. Promise.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Federal agent! Come out with your hands on your head!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Put your weapon on the ground! Do it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay! All right. Nobody needs to get hurt, okay? I’m going to put it down and slide it over. Okay? Okay, here it comes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay, ma’am?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: FEDERAL AGENT RACHEL MCCORD
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Agent Beckett!

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Congratulations. Because of you the Chechens now have our nuclear launch codes. Nice job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: You didn’t find it odd that the hostage wasn’t struggling?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She had a gun held to her head.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: She didn’t cry out for help. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because she didn’t want to give away her accent, fine. But the intel said that the operative worked alone.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: And that’s the point of the exercise. Intel is sometimes wrong. You have to use your judgment, your instinct, because the analyst that’s gathering that intel? He’s not the one that’s going to be catching a bullet. That’s going to be you. Or worse, me. Now step up your game.

utterance.speaker: CHIEF CARL VILLANTE
utterance.content: McCord!

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: Hostage Alley?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: Don’t feel bad. Everyone screws that up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I should have seen it.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: Hey, look. It’s better to die in training than in the field, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s better not to die at all.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: Yeah. Listen, uh … a few of us are grabbing a beer tonight. You want to join?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, Hendricks, I would love to, but with the caseload and the training I haven’t had a weekend off in ages and I’ve actually got plans.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: We just received a priority 7 from the AG. There’s been an incident. A potential national security breach.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, the prodigal son returns. How was the west coast book tour?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was exhausting. Twelve cities in eleven days. I signed my fingers to the bone.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Poor boy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to change. I’ll let this guy fill you in on all the details. He’s best with rhetorical questions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is Alexis back?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, yeah. She came in this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I thought she was in Costa Rica until …

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: … next week. Surprise!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Daddy? Hi!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, come here, you. How was your trip?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh … amazing! Just wait ‘til you see our pictures.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our pictures?

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Hey, Al? Where do you keep the matches? I want to light these sage bundles.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Surprise again.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, Pi. Pi, dad.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Hey, Mr. C.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Awesome to meet you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pi. Like the dessert?

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Without the ‘e’. Like the Greek letter. But personally I feel the whole spelling thing just stifles creativity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The spelling thing?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Let’s let my dad decompress. Matches are in the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s – he’s not staying here?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, he is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not in her room?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You get to have that talk. I have a class. Ta ta!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, Alexis? Could I talk to you a second?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Give him a chance, Dad. I really like him. And he’s brilliant.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Found ‘em!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ll talk about this later.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … make sure you put some blankets out on the couch for Pi if he’s staying? Want him to be comfortable. And visible. Please tell me your flight is not delayed. I don’t think I can bear another minute not seeing you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’m not a the airport.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not coming, are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just got put on a priority case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate, we haven’t seen each other in six weeks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trust me, this was not my call. I’m just as upset as you are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I know. It’s – I’m the one who canceled last time.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Beckett! Let’s go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I’ve gotta go. I’ll make this up to you, I promise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. I’m going to hold you to that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I love you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Love you, too. ‘bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you smiling about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. Can you at least finish taking that off before you shoot me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cast – Castle? What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know I promised to respect your job, but I couldn’t go another week without seeing you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, you shouldn’t have come here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you want me to leave?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, immediately.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. How long have you been up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. A couple of hours. I had some homework to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we should do some homework, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I would love to, except I’m still proving myself. I’ve gotta know these reports better than the people that wrote them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This your case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s it about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. It’s classified.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You do realize that only makes me more curious. So, is it big?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know I can’t talk about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doesn’t mean I can’t guess. It must be big, because you cancelled our weekend together. It must be local, because you’re still here. I bet I can figure this out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well that doesn’t mean that you should.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon. Don’t you miss working together?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, I do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, if I were to help you, maybe we could solve whatever this is , faster, and then we could have the whole weekend to ourselves. Wouldn’t you like that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I would. Until I got arrested for disclosing classified information.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, who’s going to know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow, they’re good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I gotta go. That’s my partner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no. I’ve got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not looking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what time will you be back?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, you know what? I’m not quite sure. I’ll give you a call as soon as I find out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, c’mon in.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Hey. Are you ready?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. I’ve just gotta get my bag.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Your fiancé’s visiting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, he is. Except he knows that we’re working.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, Castle, this is Rachel McCord. She’s my new partner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re the new partner.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Chief’s waiting. Gotta go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have fun saving – – the world. Oh, you forgot your um …

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: It’s only four months away. I want to be ready.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s going to be a long four months.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Esposito.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘sito. It’s me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle? I’ll put you on speaker.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So where’ve you been, bro? You’ve missed like, three Halo nights.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I told you. I was on a book tour.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah? You tell your book groupies you’re engaged now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re swaddling that doll right now, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So listen. We just finished a case. Come have a drink with us after work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I’d love to, but I’m working on a case of my own right now. For my next book.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ohh, so you just called us ‘cause you need some expert technical consulting?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, since you offered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m writing a scene about someone trying to investigate using only one evidence photo. A crime involving national security.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: SO your hero’s a spy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: More like a ruggedly handsome every man. Anyway, the photo is of a blown transformer, so I pulled a random photo of a transformer off the internet and there’s a serial number on the side. I’m trying to determine how much my character could figure out just from that number. I was wondering if my character’s police buddies might have any … resources.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, if your hero’s fictional cop buddies are anything like your real cop buddies, then they’d have real work to get back to, so … bye bye now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if our hero was offering Knicks floor seats?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s that serial number?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: Here we go. The AP stands for Allegra Power. They service northern Virginia.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And would it be possible to trace the location of that transformer using that number.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. The transformer with that serial number controls a ten square block region of the Ashton Height neighborhood in Arlington.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks, you guys. You saved the story.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Whoa, guys. That exact transformer was sabotaged two nights ago. And the Feds are investigating.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Arlington? Isn’t that Beckett’s backyard?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle! Is this a real case?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, actually … I … m- … in … tunnel right … m … call … later… when … better …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Smooth. All right. Why would someone blow up a transformer? Terrorism. No, that would have been in the news. To cause a blackout. How does a blackout affect national security?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The blackout momentarily shut down the CyberTech building security system. So this particular facility houses a number of government contractors. One of them is CyberTech Transnational.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Someone gained access to CyberTech’s clean room and stole a highly classified hardware security module. This is that module that contains the encryption system that serves the gateway to the military satellite network.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoever took it is capable of shutting that satellite network down completely.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Leaving a large portion of our military’s defenses blind.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: What do we know about our thieves?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Not much. There’s no prints, no trace DNA. But it was a highly complex operation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we believe whoever pulled this off had to have had military training or stealth ops. They had to blow up the transformer, disable the backup generators, then climb up this airshaft.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: And they had to do it all extremely quickly, because even though the blackout defeated the security cameras they reset on battery power five minutes later.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: But there’s no way this operation took less than five minutes. We must have video footage of them leaving.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: No, sir. We scrubbed the entire video. There’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could they still be in the building?

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: No, not if they’re still alive. The thermal imaging sweep of the entire premises came up negative.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: They must have found a way out that didn’t take them past the cameras.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: There isn’t one, sir. The outside of the building has 100% coverage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about under the building?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Under it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A research facility dealing with sensitive materials would need to have some sort of flood controls. Can you pull up a map of the drainage system in the area?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Drainage tunnels go right under the building.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: We thought of that. We checked all the access points, including the drainage grates. They’re all welded shut.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: Check them again.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: If they did use the tunnels they wouldn’t have wanted to travel too far, so they’d need to access the drainage system from a nearby area. One that’s inactive at night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like … … this golf course.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: That was Hendricks from the building. Turns out someone did pry open the drain grate and then welded it on the way out. There’s hope for you, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, at least we know we’re on the right track. Excuse me. Federal Agents.

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: Is this about the blackout the other night?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Yeah. How did you know that?

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Well, like I told the other guy, I wasn’t here, so you’ll have to talk to Watkins.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What other guy?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What the hell is he doing here?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What did you tell him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing!

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Beckett, I know he was your partner in New York –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no. I swear, I didn’t say anything to him.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Then why is he here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Agent Beckett. Agent McCord. What are you guys doing here?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I figured since, uh, Beckett was working I’d just get in a few rounds.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Where are your clubs?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Crap.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Do you realize what would happen if I told the Chief that he was here? You would be kicked off the team. Not to mention obstruction charges against you. This is my one and only warning. The next time I see you it better be on a book jacket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Okay, she is not invited to the wedding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get in a few rounds?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did you want me to say? That you accidently left out your evidence photo of the blown transformer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you went through my classified photos? What the hell were you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was trying to help. I didn’t think I’d get caught.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well you did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How’d you get here anyway? I mean, why are you here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well the transformer led me to a research park where all the tenants have government contracts. I figured they were using the blackout to circumvent the security system. But they’re not just going to waltz in through the front door. Then I remembered that case we had at The Old Haunt, where the killer used –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - used the abandoned sewer tunnels underneath New York, yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You thought of it, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except – – this isn’t New York. Do you realize how many laws were broken by looking at that photo? Are you trying to be me fired?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It would make it easier to see you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not if I was in jail.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I want to see you, too. But it can’t be like this, okay? You have to promise you’re going to stop fiddling with this investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, now. I promise. But wouldn’t you at least like to hear what I found out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. These guys didn’t see anything the night of the blackout. It was too dark. But that guard over there remembers seeing a guy a couple days ago in a late 90s model gold sedan. He was probably doing some kind of recon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you have them send over the surveillance footage –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle – Castle! Please!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m out. I’m – I didn’t – promise. Wiped from my brain. Like I wasn’t even here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve gotta go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: Nice job with the drainage tunnel. Keep up the good work, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. For uh, not saying anything about Castle.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Look, when I was a year out of Quantico I was busting my ass on this case. My first big chance, and we had been going straight for a month and I really wanted to let off some steam, so I went to a bar and I picked up a guy and I took him home. Next morning he says, ‘who’s Scofield?’. Scofield was the subject of our highly classified investigation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You talked in your sleep?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: That’s this job. Things happen. You better make sure they only happen once.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gold course security video’s in.

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: This is across the street from the golf course the day before yesterday.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Okay, our guy said the car stayed like this for fifteen minutes. Can we get a plate?

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: Ah, the angle’s just not good enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about the driver?

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: It’s a pretty clear shot. Creating a feature vector descriptor to run facial recognition.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Check the military databases first. This guy’s got training.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: This was two days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the day before the break in. He’s planning his escape route.

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: I’ve got a match. Driver was Jack Bronson, 35, recently retired marine force recon. His last rotation he worked black ops specializing in forward position infiltration.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: You got an address on this guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Clear!

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: Clear!

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s not here.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: Except he left this. Tools of the trade.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C4 to blow up the transformer, wire cutters to disable the backup generator, rope and pulleys for the airshaft. This is our guy.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Tear this place apart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not going to find that encryption system here. That’s his meal ticket. Wherever he went, that thing’s going with him.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Hendricks, call the office. Pull his phone records, run his credit cards. I want to know who he talks to, what he eats. I want to know what gym he goes to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And have him look for a girlfriend. If he’s on the run he might have help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Castle, everything okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Red or white?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of wine do you want with your salmon? I’m cooking you dinner tonight to make up for getting you in trouble at work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s so sweet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. Um, so how’s the case going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I just want to know when to start cooking. Trust me, I got the message. Cone of silence, church and state, no more interference.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well then, in that case, red. And um, can you get that kind that makes me feel all –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll buy a whole case. See you tonight.

utterance.speaker: JACK BRONSON
utterance.content: We’re going to walk over to my car together and you’re going to get in like you know me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But I don’t know you. And the salmon needs to be refrigerated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, this is a late 90s gold sedan. You’re the guy who –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, look. You’re making a mistake here, okay? I don’t know … that’s a red - that’s a red light – car!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Geez! I don’t know who you think I am –

utterance.speaker: BRONSON
utterance.content: I know who you are. You were at the golf course with the Feds. What do they know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I don’t – I’m not sure.

utterance.speaker: BRONSON
utterance.content: Are they looking at me? Do they know about Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know! I don’t know, all right? I swear. I wasn’t even supposed to be there.

utterance.speaker: BRONSON
utterance.content: Did they say – – say anything about Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey man, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, buddy. Pedal on the left.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Bronson?

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: That’s him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the hardware module?

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: It’s not in the car.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Anybody riding with him?

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: Nope. That guy.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: You’ve got to be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I’ll deal with him.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: No, you’ve already had your chance. Hendricks, please place Mr. Castle under arrest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello? Is anyone even there? Where’s Beckett? Let me talk to her.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: I’m afraid she can’t help you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, this has just been a misunderstanding.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: You were in a car with a man who we believe is an enemy combatant of the United States. That’s not a misunderstanding, Mr. Castle. That’s a federal offense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, I was abducted at gunpoint.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: Is that so? And of all the people in the world, why would our chief suspect abduct you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. He said he saw me at the golf course with Beckett and McCord.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: Why exactly were you at the golf course?

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: Why are you in D.C, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m here to see my fiancée.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: But why did you choose to see her on this particular weekend?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I … … oh now, wait a minute. You don’t think I’m involved in this, do you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, look. A man walked up to me on the street, shoved a gun in my ribs, and forced me into a car. Then he started questioning me. Whether or not you guys know about him, or about Valkyrie.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: What’s Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know! I told him I didn’t know. And then he dropped dead. Right in the car.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: Mysteriously? With you sitting right next to him.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: No, there’s nothing relevant about Valkyrie in any of our databases.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: It could be the name of Bronson’s contact or buyer. But they must have found out we were on to him and taken him out.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Which means the encryption system’s in play.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, sir, I know what this looks like, but I swear to you, Castle’s not involved in any of this.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: We know he isn’t. We have ATM footage of him being abducted at gunpoint, just like he said.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then why did –

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: I needed to make sure he told us everything he knew. And given your fiancé’s history, he needed to learn once and for all to keep his nose out of federal business.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: Any word yet on how Bronson died?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: They’re doing the autopsy right now.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: Sir. We’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, what about Castle?

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: Let him sweat.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: So this is Jeanette Miller, Bronson’s girlfriend and most likely his accomplice. They’ve been dating for six months. Phone records show that Bronson called her a number of times right before he abducted Mr. Castle. And get this, she worked as an aide to Senator Shelton.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shelton’s a ranking member of the foreign relations committee.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: She’d have the connections to help Bronson move the encryption out of the country.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: She’s part of this. Find her, you find that system. You have a location on her?

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: We tracked the GPS on her phone to a street in Rosemont, but when we moved in a few minutes ago we found the phone and her car both abandoned.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: She’s off the grid. She knows we’re looking for her.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: I want every inch of this city under surveillance. You tap into every sidewalk and mass transit video feed. Run facial recognition with a 70% match. She may have altered her appearance. I want her found.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Got it, sir.

utterance.speaker: VILLANTE
utterance.content: Not you, Beckett. You and I have something else to discuss.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please tell me there’s something stronger than coffee in there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … how much trouble am I in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not as much as me. Look, Castle …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t make it like it was before, can I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe it’ll be better. This way when we come home at the end of each day we’ll have something to talk about like normal couples.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only your day will be classified.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re going to make this work, I promise. I’ll have a couple of days off after this case and we’ll figure it out. But until then …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t say it. I’ll be on the first flight out in the morning.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Mr. C! Que pasa?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pi. Where’s Alexis?

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: She went shopping with her grandma. I volunteered to make dinner tonight and I’m just getting a jump on the prep. Can I count you in on a nice juicy steak?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These aren’t steaks.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: It’s papaya steak. It’s the juiciest steak there is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is all fruit.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: I’m fruitarian.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course you are.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: It’s all that I eat. Original diet of mankind. Nutrition as God intended.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Pi, don’t take this the wrong way, but how long do you plan on staying as Casa de Castle?

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: You know, I’m actually in a little bit of a bind. See, I live in Amsterdam, but I, uh, kinda lost my passport. But hey, you don’t want to hear about my troubles. You’ve got your own, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do, now. You gonna clean all this up?

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Mr. C, I get the feeling things didn’t go to well in D.C with your fiancée, did they?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Pi. They did not.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: You know, sometimes the best thing to do is talk about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? You’re absolutely right.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to find someone to talk about it with.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Any luck tracking down Bronson’s girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Castle get home okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep. Fine.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: You want to talk about it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Good. You got a hit?

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: Possible match. Uh … 87% certainty.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Bring it up.

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: This is traffic cam video streaming live.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she dyed her hair, but that’s her.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: And that bag on her shoulder …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think she’s got the encryption system in it?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Let’s go find out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait. We’re losing her.

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: Switching feeds. There.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Where is this?

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: 20th and P, near DuPont Circle.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: This is McCord. We need to acquire a target near DuPont Circle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re losing her again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s gone.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Richmond.

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: She must have ducked into a store, or an alley.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Or the Metro. Damn it. Stand by.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you display the route that she was following?

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: Okay. it’s analyzing her path.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It doesn’t look like she was taking a direct route. It’s like she’s using evasive tactics. Okay, so she started off in Rosemont. Her general trajectory leads to … Union Station.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: She’s making a run for it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, I don’t think Jenny and I have been apart for more than two days since we met. It’s gotta be rough.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just feel like we’re so out of sync I don’t know how to get back. I guess I was just … trying to make it feel like us again.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, by playing me and Ryan for chumps. You should have known that we were going to figure out this case was real.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you’ll be happy to know for my sins I was abducted by a maniac at gunpoint and nearly killed. But at least I didn’t get Beckett fired.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, abducted? By who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look guys, I really shouldn’t be talking about this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle. It’s us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And thanks to you, we’re already involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, but this go no further, all right? So I’m walking down the street and this guy that they’re looking for grabs me, shoves me into a car, starts talking crazy, starts asking me all these questions.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What kind of questions?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something about Valkyrie, and then I thought he was going to pass out, because he was talking about going off to dream world. But he didn’t pass out. He dropped dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh … this guy? Was he, uh, was he military?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why? Is Valkyrie a military term?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know about Valkyrie, but Dream World? It’s a highly classified special operations base in the Gulf. It’s a ghost base. The government’s never confirmed its existence, but I – I met a guy who knew a guy who was stationed there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where is it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s – it’s a ghost base, Castle. You think it’s going to say where it is?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. But I will tell you this, if Beckett’s case has anything to do with this base, well, then she’s into something way bigger than she realizes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Target is moving to the mezzanine. Close in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, wait. Not yet.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Stand by. Would you like her to catch a train?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, something else is going on. She abandoned her car in Rosemont and then she came all the way up here?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Maybe she thought she was being followed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why didn’t she just hop the train in Alexandria?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Maybe the line she wants only leaves from here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe she’s meeting her buyer here. You’re the one that told me to follow my instincts and my instincts say that we should wait.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: I give your instincts two minutes. Hold positions.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Where is she? Where did she go?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: You know what? I knew we shouldn’t have don’t this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. By the lockers!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jeanette Miller, Federal Agents. You’re under arrest.

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Let’s do this quietly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Step away.

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: What? What’d I do?

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: Look, I told you. I’ve never seen this before in my life.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Then what was it doing in that locker?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trafficking government property, jeopardizing national security, treason, each one is punishable by life imprisonment.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Or worse. What was the plan, anyway? Did someone hire you and Jack Bronson to steal -

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: You don’t understand! This isn’t how it looks.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Really? Because you dumped your phone and then you dumped your car. And you dyed your hair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Clearly you were trying to disappear.

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: Because Jack was in trouble. He’s being set up. We both are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jeanette –

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: Listen, he got a call a couple of nights ago. Someone wanting to meet him at a golf course. And whatever they said freaked Jack out. So he went out there, but the guy never showed. And then when he heard about the break in, he realized. They set him up.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: He didn’t know. But Jack was scared. And Jack does not get scared. And he said we needed to go on the run until he could figure out what was going on. And he told me to go to his locker in Union Station, that there’d be money there, and that he’d meet up with me when he could.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, if he wasn’t involved then how did that end up in his locker?

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe it was part of the setup.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What’s Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What did Jack tell you about Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: Look, where is Jack? Do you know where he is?

utterance.speaker: JEANETTE
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: She had the encryption system, she had the overseas contacts, and yet, after everything she did she expects us to believe she wasn’t involved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, people do crazy things when they’re in love.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: I noticed. Don’t tell me you believe her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she’s right. Bronson was being set up.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: And why do you think that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The tools in his apartment, the security footage from the golf course? Even the encryption system in his locker. Someone with his training wouldn’t be that sloppy.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: You know what the hardest thing about this job is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Knowing when to stop doing this job. We have the encryption system. We got the bad guy. This is a victory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wasn’t wrong in the train station and I’m not wrong here. There is something that we’re missing.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s just say someone did have it out for Bronson. Why would they go through all the effort to orchestrate a blackout, break into a secure government facility, only to steal something that they knew we’d recover? There are many easier ways to set someone up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait. I mean, you’re right. Why would someone go through all the trouble to steal something just so we’d recover it? Unless it was a diversion. What if it wasn’t the encryption system that they were really after?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: They just wanted us to think that that’s what they were after.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the airshaft that they used to access CyberTech, they could have used that to access any of the floors in that same building.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: CyberTech is on floors three and four …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, and … … five and six are a genetics lab, seven is a consulting firm, and eight …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … there are no details about the tenant on eight. It says it’s classified. What’s on eight?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Are you coming, dad? Dinner’s ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yes, I best hurry. I wouldn’t want my papaya steak to get cold.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Have you even tried them? They’re delicious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe you should get started without me. I’m right in the middle of something.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re not avoiding Pi, are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, sweetheart. I’m just doing some research for a story.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You sure you’re not still looking into Beckett’s case? Even after you promised not to?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I’ll get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, it’s fine. No one is ever going to know.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, these men are here for you. They say they’re federal agents.

utterance.speaker: AGENT
utterance.content: Castle, you need to come with us, right away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is this about?

utterance.speaker: AGENT
utterance.content: Please, sir. Just come with us.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, wait a minute. You can’t just take him away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do me a favor, um … call my lawyer. And call Beckett!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay. Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, finally. What’s going on? Why won’t anyone talk to me? And why would they take my blood?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you know that case that I’ve been investigating? The break in, the theft?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it turns out there’s more to it than we thought.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you going to water board me? Because that would seriously affect our relationship.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, babe, can you listen for a second?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … it turns out that something else was stolen from another lab in that building. It was a chemical agent that they were working on for the military, but it was deemed too dangerous to use. The amount stolen was enough to kill thousands of people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn’t this … need to know stuff? Why are you telling me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because that toxin was used to kill Jack Bronson. The man who abducted you. It was aerosolized. It was placed in the ventilation system of his car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was in that car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was I - ?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How bad?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Based on the amount found in your bloodstream you have less than a day to live.
